name: ListCashDrawerShifts
description:
Retrieve cash drawer shift details for a location and date range.

Use this tool to obtain detailed information about cash drawer shifts for a specific location during a specified date range. Ideal for managing and auditing cash flows in business operations.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location to retrieve cash drawer shifts for.

value_schema.description: The ID of the location to query for a list of cash drawer shifts.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specifies the order of cash drawer shifts based on their opened_at field. Options are 'ASC' for ascending and 'DESC' for descending. Default is 'ASC'.

value_schema.description:
The order in which cash drawer shifts are listed in the response,
based on their opened_at field. Default value: ASC

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The inclusive start time for the query in ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: The inclusive start time of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: exclusive_query_end_time
parameters.description: The exclusive end time for the query on opened_at, provided in ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: The exclusive end date of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of cash drawer shift events per page. Default is 200, with a maximum of 1000.

value_schema.description:
Number of cash drawer shift events in a page of results (200 by
default, 1000 max).

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Opaque cursor used for fetching the next page of results from the API.

value_schema.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

value_schema.description: The inclusive start time of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: end_time

value_schema.description: The exclusive end date of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Number of cash drawer shift events in a page of results (200 by
default, 1000 max).

value_schema.description:
Number of cash drawer shift events in a page of results (200 by
default, 1000 max).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.

value_schema.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
